item.title: The Story of Chrome's Little Dinasour
item.description:
Did you ever see a little dinosaur on Google Chrome when you lost connection of Internet. It’s cute right.

Actually, it’s a game. If you want to play the game, just shut off your wifi connection and view any webpages, then just hit Space key on your keyboard to get started.

item.title: Install Google Chrome on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
item.description:
A very simple step to install Google Chrome from terminal. Just open your terminal Ctrl + Alt + T and type in following command to install Google Chrome.

If you don’t know what architechture of your operating system. You can check it out by typing uname -i on your terminal.

64-Bit Installation

1. Download Latest Google Chrome

wget https://dl.google.com/linux/direct/google-chrome-stable_current_amd64.deb

2. Install Google Chrome

sudo dpkg -i google-chrome*.deb

32-Bit Installation

1. Download Latest Google Chrome

wget https://dl.google.com/linux/direct/google-chrome-stable_current_i386.deb

2. Install Google Chrome

sudo dpkg -i google-chrome*.deb

item.title: How to remove Status Bar from Oracle's Virtual Box Window on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
item.description:
Just a very simple step to hide Status Bar on Oracle’s VirtualBox on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS. Just open your terminal Ctrl + Alt + T and type in following command

/usr/bin/VBoxManage setextradata global GUI/Customizations noStatusBar

If you would like to restore the Status Bar. Just type in following command

/usr/bin/VBoxManage setextradata global GUI/Customizations StatusBar

item.title: Install youtube-dl on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
item.description:
youtube-dl is a small command-line program to download videos from YouTube, Vimeo, dailymotion and a few more sites.

1. Download and Install youtube-dl

sudo wget https://yt-dl.org/downloads/latest/youtube-dl -O /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl

2. Change permission

sudo chmod a+x /usr/local/bin/youtube-dl

3. Test it

youtube-dl http://yourlinkhere

For more information regarding about youtube-dl, you can check out it’s documentation or you can type in following command on terminal

youtube-dl -help

item.title: Make your Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS looks Beautiful with Numix Icon and Theme
item.description:
I love Ubuntu 14.04.1 and all the Numix Project’s works like Numix Circle and Numix Dark GTK Theme. Here the easy guide to install Numix Project’s Themes and Icons on your Ubuntu.

Installing Numix Project Theme and Icon

1. Add Numix Project’s PPA

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:numix/ppa

2. Update package

sudo apt-get update

3. Install Numix Dark and Numix Circle

sudo apt-get install numix-icon-theme-circle && sudo apt-get install numix-gtk-theme

Set up the Themes and Icons

1. Installing Unity Tweak Tool

sudo apt-get install unity-tweak-tool

2. Set up the Themes and Icons

Once you already install Unity Tweak Tool. You can launch it by search using Dash and type unity tweak tool. Now you can change the theme and icon by go to Appearances > Theme > Numix and Appearances > Icons > Numix-circle.

item.title: Install Jekyll on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
item.description:
Jekyll is a simple, blog-aware, static site generator. It takes a template directory containing raw text files in various formats, runs it through Markdown (or Textile) and Liquid converters, and spits out a complete, ready-to-publish static website suitable for serving with your favorite web server.

Installing Jekyll

1. Installing Ruby and RubyGems

sudo apt-get install ruby ruby-dev make

2. Installing NodeJs

sudo apt-get install nodejs

3. Installing Jekyll via RubyGems

sudo gem install jekyll

4. Check your Jekyll Installation

jekyll -v

If your terminal return something like jekyll 2.5.3. Your Jekyll Installation is succesful. The version may be different. For the latest version checkout at Jekyll.

Quick Start Guide

1. Change directory to Desktop

cd Desktop

2. Create the sites using Jekyll and name the folder to kumbang

jekyll new kumbang

3. Change directory to kumbang

cd kumbang

4. Run the Sites

jekyll serve

Now, you can browse your sites using browser at http://127.0.0.1:4000/ or http://localhost:4000. To learn more about Jekyll, checkout Jekyll Documentation.

item.title: Install Git on Ubuntu 14.04.1 LTS
item.description:
Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency. You can easily install Git using terminal on Ubuntu by typing a command below :

sudo apt-get install git

If you would like to learn basic about Git, you can try it on your browser.
